decks.notes: This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay and sacrificing creatures for maximum value. It includes a mix of creatures that benefit from each other's presence, such as Boros Reckoner and Champion of the Parish. The deck also includes several powerful sacrifice outlets like Cartel Aristocrat and Falkenrath Aristocrat, which can be used to protect valuable creatures or trigger abilities. The deck also has access to some removal and disruption with cards like Orzhov Charm and Zealous Conscripts. Overall, the deck aims to swarm the board, create advantageous trades, and potentially overwhelm the opponent.

A deck focused on aggressive gameplay using a combination of red and white spells with a splash of blue for control and card advantage. The deck aims to quickly build a board presence with efficient creatures like Boros Reckoner and Augur of Bolas while utilizing burn spells like Boros Charm and Searing Spear to control the board and finish off opponents. Restoration Angel provides additional flying threats, while Sphinx's Revelation offers the ability to refill your hand and gain life in longer games. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain it throughout the game.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through card draw, counterspells, and removal while gaining incremental advantage over time. By utilizing cards like Azorius Charm and Supreme Verdict to control the board, along with Sphinx's Revelation for card advantage, the player aims to outlast their opponent and win through attrition. The inclusion of Nephalia Drownyard also provides an alternate win condition by milling the opponent's deck. The deck focuses on maintaining control of the game state and grinding out a victory through resource management and strategic play.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent by deploying aggressive creatures such as Boros Reckoner, Flinthoof Boar, and Hellrider. The deck benefits from mana acceleration through cards like Burning-Tree Emissary and Gyre Sage to consistently put pressure on the opponent. In addition, the deck includes powerful finishers like Thundermaw Hellkite and Thragtusk to seal the victory. The inclusion of removal spells like Mizzium Mortars and a Planeswalker like Domri Rade provide additional versatility and control. The overall strategy is to maintain a fast tempo and outpace the opponent to secure a swift victory.

The main concept of this Jund control deck is to maintain control of the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. It utilizes a combination of powerful creatures like Huntmaster of the Fells, Olivia Voldaren, and Thragtusk to generate value and stabilize the battlefield. It also includes removal spells, such as Abrupt Decay, Dreadbore, and Murder, to eliminate threats from the opponent's side. The deck also features powerful board wipes like Bonfire of the Damned to regain control. Additionally, it includes planeswalkers like Garruk, Primal Hunter and Liliana of the Veil for additional card advantage and disruption.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by using powerful creatures like Huntmaster of the Fells, Olivia Voldaren, and Thragtusk, along with removal spells like Abrupt Decay, Dead Weight, and Victim of Night. Additionally, the deck includes planeswalkers like Garruk, Primal Hunter and Liliana of the Veil to generate card advantage and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck focuses on managing threats, generating value, and ultimately outlasting the opponent to secure a victory.

The key concept of this Bant Control deck is to ensure board control and card advantage through a combination of answers, lifegain, and card draw. The deck aims to stall the opponent's creatures with Supreme Verdict and Detention Sphere while gaining life through Thragtusk and Centaur Healer. Card draw is accomplished through Think Twice and Sphinx's Revelation, providing the player with a steady stream of resources. The deck also includes counterspells like Dissipate and Syncopate to prevent opponents' key spells. Overall, the key concept is to control the game while maintaining card advantage and outlasting the opponent.

The deck focuses on a fast-paced aggressive strategy using a combination of creatures with powerful abilities like Boros Reckoner and Restoration Angel along with burn spells like Searing Spear and Mizzium Mortars to quickly deal damage to the opponent. Augur of Bolas and Snapcaster Mage provide card advantage and utility spells like Azorius Charm and Sphinx's Revelation help to control the board and gain card advantage. The deck also has some counterspells and board wipes for added versatility and protection. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of creatures and spells.

The main focus of this deck is to play aggressively, utilizing creatures with low mana costs and high power/toughness to quickly overwhelm opponents. The deck uses cards like Arbor Elf and Burning-Tree Emissary to ramp up mana production and quickly put powerful creatures like Wolfir Silverheart onto the battlefield. Cards like Domri Rade and Increasing Savagery provide additional support and buffing capabilities. Overall, the deck aims to maintain a fast pace and put pressure on opponents early in the game to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on rapidly deploying aggressive creatures to overwhelm the opponent and deal damage quickly. The key strategy is to quickly build a board presence with cards like Burning-Tree Emissary, Falkenrath Aristocrat, and Ghor-Clan Rampager, while using removal spells like Abrupt Decay, Dreadbore, and Searing Spear to control the opponent's board. By combining efficient creatures with removal spells, this deck aims to put pressure on the opponent and maintain a strong tempo throughout the game.

The main focus of this Gruul Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The key strategy revolves around playing efficient creatures like Boros Reckoner, Burning-Tree Emissary, and Hellrider to quickly deal damage to the opponent. This is supported by a mix of burn spells like Searing Spear and Pillar of Flame to remove any blockers or finish off the opponent. The deck aims to have a fast start and maintain pressure throughout the game to secure a quick victory.

This Jund Aggro deck focuses on fast and aggressive creature plays, utilizing cards like Dreg Mangler, Ghor-Clan Rampager, and Hellrider to deal damage quickly. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Tragic Slip to deal with opposing threats. With a strong mana base and a mix of creatures and spells, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with constant pressure and efficient removal, making it a formidable force in 1 vs 1 Standard matches.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through various removal spells and strong creatures, such as Huntmaster of the Fells and Thragtusk. The deck utilizes mana ramp with cards like Farseek and Arbor Elf to bring out powerful threats early on. It also includes a mix of Planeswalkers like Garruk, Primal Hunter and Liliana of the Veil to provide additional value and control elements. The deck's win condition revolves around overwhelming the opponent with strong creatures and removal spells, taking advantage of the powerful mid-to-late game cards like Bonfire of the Damned and Rakdos's Return.

This deck focuses on maintaining control over the game by removing threats with targeted removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Victim of Night, as well as board wipes like Mizzium Mortars. It also aims to disrupt the opponent's hand with cards like Rakdos's Return and Liliana of the Veil. The deck's win condition is generating card advantage and value through powerful creatures like Huntmaster of the Fells and Thragtusk, while also having strong finishers like Olivia Voldaren and Thundermaw Hellkite. Additionally, the deck has ramp spells like Farseek to help it cast its powerful spells more quickly.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of aggressive zombie creatures. By efficiently playing low-cost zombies like Diregraf Ghoul and Gravecrawler alongside powerful threats like Geralf's Messenger and Falkenrath Aristocrat, it aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The deck also includes removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Tragic Slip to clear the way for the zombies to attack. With a mix of aggression and strategic removal, this deck aims to outpace and overpower the opponent in a fast-paced one-on-one match.

This deck focuses on controlling the board with strong removal spells and defensive creatures, while also having the potential to deal massive damage with powerful creatures like Aurelia, the Warleader and Thundermaw Hellkite. It utilizes a mix of black and red mana sources to cast a variety of spells, including Bonfire of the Damned for a big finish. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan and outvalue them with powerful threats that can quickly turn the tide of the game.

The main theme of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage to maintain board control and outvalue the opponent. The deck runs a combination of creatures with value abilities and powerful spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The Cavern of Souls is included to protect creatures from counterspells, while cards like Sphinx's Revelation provide card advantage and life gain. The deck aims to outlast the opponent and win through incremental advantage and superior card selection.

This deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures like Angel of Glory's Rise and then reanimate them using Unburial Rites. By using cards like Faithless Looting, Grisly Salvage, and Mulch to dump creatures into the graveyard and Farseek to ramp up mana, the combo can be executed quickly. Cartel Aristocrat and Fiend Hunter provide protection and disruption, while Huntmaster of the Fells offers both value and a threat on the board. The key strategy is to continually reanimate powerful creatures while controlling the board and overwhelming the opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana and continuously applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Deathrite Shaman, Dreg Mangler, and Ghor-Clan Rampager. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient damage output, utilizing powerful creatures such as Hellrider and Falkenrath Aristocrat. The deck also includes removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Searing Spear to deal with opposing threats. Overall, the strategy revolves around maintaining a fast pace and overwhelming the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on controlling the board with efficient removal spells and powerful creatures like Thragtusk and Vampire Nighthawk. It also includes planeswalkers like Garruk, Primal Hunter and Liliana of the Veil for additional card advantage. The deck can generate card advantage and strong board presence with Huntmaster of the Fells and Olivia Voldaren, while also having access to powerful finishers like Rakdos's Return and Bonfire of the Damned. The mana base is designed to support the color requirements of the deck and ensure consistent casting of spells.

The main concept of this deck is to control the board with removal spells and powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil, while also generating card advantage with cards like Huntmaster of the Fells and Thragtusk. The deck aims to ramp up its mana quickly with cards like Farseek and Deathrite Shaman to cast big threats like Olivia Voldaren and Garruk, Primal Hunter. The mana base is built around the Jund colors to ensure consistency in casting the spells required for control and ramp strategies.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using efficient and powerful creatures such as Champion of the Parish, Mayor of Avabruck, and Huntmaster of the Fells. The deck aims to quickly build a board presence and pressure the opponent with creatures that have synergistic abilities like Silverblade Paladin's double strike or Frontline Medic's indestructible ability. The inclusion of cards like Rootbound Crag and Temple Garden allow for smooth mana fixing and ramping into bigger threats like Restoration Angel and Kessig Wolf Run for additional reach and value. Additionally, the deck includes disruption in the form of Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to slow down opponents casting non-creature spells. Overall, the deck is focused on presenting an aggressive and resilient game plan to quickly close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence with aggressive creatures like Boros Reckoner, Champion of the Parish, and Falkenrath Aristocrat. Utilizing sacrifice effects from Cartel Aristocrat and Skirsdag High Priest, the deck aims to generate value by sacrificing creatures to trigger abilities and buff other creatures. The addition of Zealous Conscripts allows for potential explosive plays by stealing opponent's creatures. Lingering Souls and Orzhov Charm provide additional utility and flexibility to deal with various threats. Overall, the deck focuses on efficient aggressive strategies while maintaining a synergistic sacrifice theme.

The main concept of this deck is to control the pace of the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to outvalue the opponent. The deck aims to consistently hit land drops and stabilize the board with board wipes like Supreme Verdict and Terminus, while generating card advantage with cards like Sphinx's Revelation and Nephalia Drownyard. The win condition of the deck is to outlast the opponent and overwhelm them with powerful planeswalkers like Jace, Architect of Thought and Tamiyo, the Moon Sage, backed up by Lingering Souls tokens for additional pressure.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively use creatures and burn spells to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero. It combines efficient creatures like Ash Zealot, Boros Reckoner, and Flinthoof Boar with strong burn spells like Searing Spear and Pillar of Flame to maintain constant pressure on the opponent. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, powerful creatures and direct damage spells, ultimately leading to a quick victory.

The main concept of this Jund Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient and aggressive creatures, backed up by removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Dreadbore. By utilizing a combination of fast, hard-hitting creatures like Ghor-Clan Rampager and Hellrider, the deck aims to pressure the opponent quickly and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize. Additionally, cards like Experiment One and Strangleroot Geist provide resilience and flexibility in combat, allowing the deck to maintain its aggressive edge throughout the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures that can quickly apply pressure on the opponent, backed up by efficient removal spells to clear the way for your creatures to deal damage. By incorporating a mixture of low-cost creatures like Rakdos Cackler and Burning-Tree Emissary, alongside powerful threats like Falkenrath Aristocrat and Ghor-Clan Rampager, the deck aims to establish a dominant board presence early in the game. The inclusion of cards like Abrupt Decay and Dreadbore also allows for flexibility in dealing with opposing threats, ensuring that the deck can maintain tempo and overwhelm the opponent.

The deck is focused on using a combination of powerful creatures and removal spells to control the board and outvalue the opponent. It includes versatile removal spells such as Abrupt Decay and Dreadbore, along with threats like Huntmaster of the Fells and Thragtusk to apply pressure. The deck also has access to planeswalkers like Garruk, Primal Hunter and Liliana of the Veil for additional value. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through a combination of removal, threats, and card advantage to outlast and outplay the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through the use of powerful removal spells like Abrupt Decay, Dreadbore, and Ultimate Price, as well as disruptive creatures like Olivia Voldaren and Vampire Nighthawk. The deck also includes resilient threats like Huntmaster of the Fells and Thragtusk to stabilize the board. Garruk, Primal Hunter provides card advantage and generates threats, while Rakdos's Return can help finish off opponents. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's powerful spells and creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to use a combination of powerful creatures and removal spells to control the game and dominate the board. By utilizing cards like Huntmaster of the Fells, Thragtusk, Olivia Voldaren, and Garruk, Primal Hunter, the player can create a strong board presence while eliminating threats with cards like Dreadbore, Abrupt Decay, and Bonfire of the Damned. Additionally, the deck includes mana ramp spells like Farseek to ensure the player can quickly cast their powerful creatures and spells.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing powerful removal spells like Abrupt Decay, Dreadbore, and Ultimate Price to deal with threats on the board. The deck also relies on powerful creatures like Huntmaster of the Fells, Olivia Voldaren, and Thragtusk to apply pressure and stabilize the board. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Rakdos's Return and Bonfire of the Damned to finish off opponents or clear the board when needed. Overall, the deck aims to maintain control of the game while gradually overwhelming opponents with its powerful threats and removal spells.

This deck focuses on gaining control of the game through a combination of powerful creatures and removal spells. It relies on using cards like Thragtusk and Restoration Angel to stabilize the board, while also using Sphinx's Revelation to gain card advantage and life. The deck includes various counterspells and removal like Azorius Charm and Supreme Verdict to deal with opposing threats. The mana base is optimized to ensure smooth mana production for the various colored spells in the deck. Overall, the strategy is to outlast the opponent and control the game until victory is achieved.

The main focus of this Bant Control deck is to maintain board control through a combination of removal spells like Supreme Verdict and Detention Sphere, counterspells like Dissipate, and efficient creatures like Thragtusk and Restoration Angel. The deck also aims to gain card advantage and stabilize its life total with spells such as Sphinx's Revelation and Centaur Healer. By controlling the board and out-valuing the opponent, this deck aims to win the game through attrition and incremental advantage, ultimately emerging victorious in the late game.

This deck focuses on utilizing low-cost, efficient creatures to quickly build up a strong board presence and deal damage to the opponent. By playing cards like Avacyn's Pilgrim and Burning-Tree Emissary, the deck aims to ramp up its mana quickly and flood the board with aggressive creatures like Boros Elite and Champion of the Parish. The deck also includes cards like Boros Charm and Rancor to provide additional combat tricks and pump up creatures for extra damage. The goal of the deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy.

The key concept of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to quickly ramp up mana with cards like Arbor Elf and Farseek, while also utilizing powerful creatures like Loxodon Smiter and Thragtusk to apply pressure on the opponent. With cards like Aurelia, the Warleader and Restoration Angel providing additional aggressive threats, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient creature-based strategy. Additionally, cards like Bonfire of the Damned and Mizzium Mortars provide versatility in dealing with opposing threats, while Oblivion Ring offers removal options for problematic permanents.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with cards like Farseek and mana-fixing lands to cast powerful creatures like Thragtusk and Restoration Angel. It also includes powerful aggressive cards like Aurelia, the Warleader and Wolfir Silverheart to pressure opponents. Boros Reckoner and Boros Charm provide versatility in dealing damage and protecting your creatures. The inclusion of Huntmaster of the Fells and Angel of Serenity adds more value to the deck, making it a strong Aggro deck that can quickly overwhelm opponents with a combination of efficient creatures and powerful spells.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and quick damage output. By utilizing efficient creatures like Boros Reckoner, Burning-Tree Emissary, and Flinthoof Boar, along with powerful support cards like Hellrider and Thundermaw Hellkite, the deck aims to continuously apply pressure and end the game quickly. Cards like Domri Rade and Mizzium Mortars also provide additional utility and removal options to maintain board control. The mana base is designed to support a consistent early game aggression while also allowing for powerful late-game plays.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of efficient removal spells like Searing Spear and Mizzium Mortars, versatile spells like Azorius Charm and Izzet Charm, and powerful board wipes like Supreme Verdict. It also includes card advantage engines like Sphinx's Revelation and Snapcaster Mage. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by trading resources efficiently and disrupting their game plan with counterspells like Counterflux. The win condition is often through attrition and incremental advantage, with cards like Boros Reckoner and Restoration Angel providing additional threats.

The main focus of this Jeskai Aggro deck is to maintain a balance between aggression and control. By utilizing efficient creatures like Boros Reckoner and Restoration Angel, along with versatile spells like Azorius Charm and Izzet Charm, the deck seeks to apply pressure on the opponent while also being able to handle threats and disrupt their game plan. The inclusion of cards like Sphinx's Revelation and Supreme Verdict provide additional options for card advantage and board control, allowing the deck to adapt to different scenarios and outmaneuver opponents.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Boros Reckoner and Geist of Saint Traft to quickly deal damage to the opponent. Cards like Snapcaster Mage and Restoration Angel provide additional value and versatility. Azorius Charm, Boros Charm, Pillar of Flame, and Searing Spear are used for removal and to control the board. The deck also includes a few instant cards like Devil's Play and Izzet Charm for added flexibility. The mana base allows for quick and consistent access to red, white, and blue mana sources for a balanced and aggressive gameplay.
